intro: Aspicarpon, commonly known as the "scented shield fern," is a rare and specialized fern species belonging to the family Polypodiaceae. It is characterized by its unique, shield-shaped fronds that are often covered in a waxy, scented coating. The plant thrives in humid, shaded environments, typically found in tropical and subtropical regions. Its reproductive structures, known as sori, are located on the underside of the fronds and produce spores for propagation. Aspicarpon is of interest to botanists due to its distinct morphology and ecological niche.
